result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke P Wszelaki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, civil judgment if not paid.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by agent, except the defendant may have third party contact for purposes of contact with the child as approved by the agent.
No firearms.

Complete Batterers Intevention program and a course in anger management.
Attend parenting classes if needed.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke P Wszelaki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luke P Wszelaki in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Luke P Wszelaki in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was set for a jury trial today.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
Plea hearing continued.....
.
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued....
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Statement by Mary S.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served; No Huber privileges.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend parenting classes, if needed.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent, except the defendant may have 3rd party contact for purposes of contact with the child, as approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- No firearms.
- Pay supervision fees.

 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36 on 10/30/2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Luke P Wszelaki in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 36 on 08/17/2015 at 8:30am.  State rescinded their offer. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO ADJOURN.
Final pre-trial on August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luke P Wszelaki NOT in court, appearance waived, with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at request of branch 36. Matter set for Final Pretrial on 8/11/2015. Branch 36 is not in session on that date. Court VACATED final pretrial date, and reset matter for Final Pretrial before branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luke P Wszelaki in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court informed parties that any motions must be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mary S

Defendant Luke P Wszelaki in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Luke P Wszelaki in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
